meta.article_title: January 23, 2012 - Forcing an Opponent Out of Position

forcing-an-opponent-out-of-position.probleme: Forcing an opponent out of position

debutant.probleme: Playing one ball wide to forehand or backhand
debutant.solution: Move the opponent side to side
Go to the opponent's middle (playing elbow)

intermediaire.probleme: Short to forehand, deep to backhand
intermediaire.solution: Serve or drop a ball short to forehand

intermediaire.probleme: Short to backhand, deep to forehand
intermediaire.solution: Serve or drop a ball short to backhand

avance.probleme: Deep to backhand against a forehand player
avance.solution: Play the ball deep to backhand over and over

exercices_complementaires.description: Playing one ball wide to either the forehand or backhand.
Going to the opponent's middle (playing elbow).

exercices_complementaires.nom: Short to forehand, deep to backhand
exercices_complementaires.description: Serving or dropping a ball short to the forehand and then playing deep to the backhand.

exercices_complementaires.nom: Short to backhand, deep to forehand
exercices_complementaires.description: Serving or dropping a ball short to the backhand and then playing deep to the forehand.

exercices_complementaires.nom: Deep to backhand against a forehand player
exercices_complementaires.description: Playing the ball deep to the backhand over and over, often by pushing, until the opponent steps around to attack with their forehand.
